entry.title: Editors Building (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that new employees of a business headquartered in the Editors Building (pictured) chose their office decorations from a 7,000-piece collection of historic memorabilia of Washington, D.C.?

entry.title: Allenbya holmesae (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that the fossil insect Allenbya holmesae was named after its finder's mother's maiden name?

entry.title: Eric Sievers (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Eric Sievers helped the San Diego Chargers set an NFL record for receptions by tight ends on a team?

entry.title: Adabijoti Soveti (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that the literary magazine Adabijoti Soveti was the sole remaining publication in the Jewish-Bukharian language by the time of the switch to the Cyrillic script in 1939–1940?

entry.title: Charlize Mörz (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Charlize Mörz became the first Austrian female gymnast to win a gold medal in the FIG World Cup series in 2024?

entry.title: Fly Me to the Moon (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that the 2023 drama film Fly Me to the Moon was Sasha Chuk's debut as a director, screenwriter and lead actress, making it her first feature film in all three categories?

entry.title: Michael Martin (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that with the appointment of Michael Martin as Bishop of Charlotte, the Conventual Franciscans are now the most represented religious order among American Catholic bishops?

entry.title: an existing vegetarian restaurant (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that in 1990, Simon Rimmer bought an existing vegetarian restaurant with his business partner and taught himself to cook – in that order?

entry.title: 2017 Aztec High School shooting (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that the perpetrator of the 2017 Aztec High School shooting had previously been investigated by the FBI, but the investigation was closed after he convinced them that he was simply "trolling"?
